newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian OTC market ends higher.
newsitem.headline: Romanian OTC market ends higher.

text.p: Strong demand for oil refineries pushed Romania's over-the-counter (OTC) market higher on Tuesday, traders said.
"Foreign interest in refineries was strong today, and it will probably remain so throughout the week," one trader said.
Gainers led decliners by 194 to 69 and 252 stocks were unchanged.
Three independent indices computed by securities companies based on average prices and market capitalisation moved higher from Monday's session.
The VAB-RA all-share index was up 3.4 percent to 6,432.9 points, BIG-OTC rose by 2.78 percent to 5,041.23 and CAS-RQ climbed 2.47 percent to 1,131 points.
Petromidia oil refinery closed 1,500 lei higher at 47,500 under strong buying preesure, while Astra Romana refinery inched up 200 lei to 2,200. Arpechim, another refinery, closed flat at 53,000 lei.
Steel mill Sidex jumped 700 lei to 24,200 in late trading.
Turnover on Tuesday fell to 30.5 billion lei from 38.01 billion previously
